009package Ch13_ColorImages;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * ImageJ plugin, increases the brightness of a RGB color image by 10 units
018 * (each color component) using bit operations (Version 1). See Sec. 13.1 (Prog.
019 * 13.1) of [1] for details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029public class Brighten_Rgb_1 implements PlugInFilter {
030        
031        private static int INCREASE = 10;       // increase by 10 units
032        
033        @Override
034        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
035                return DOES_RGB;        // this plugin works on RGB images 
036        }
037
038        @Override
039        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
040                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();  
041
042                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) { 
043                        int c = pixels[i];                         
044                        // split color pixel into rgb-components
045                        int r = (c & 0xff0000) >> 16;          
046                        int g = (c & 0x00ff00) >> 8; 
047                        int b = (c & 0x0000ff);
048                        // modify colors
049                        r = r + INCREASE; if (r > 255) r = 255;  
050                        g = g + INCREASE; if (g > 255) g = 255;
051                        b = b + INCREASE; if (b > 255) b = 255;
052                        // reassemble color pixel and insert into pixel array
053                        pixels[i] = ((r & 0xff)<<16) | ((g & 0xff)<<8) | b & 0xff; 
054                }
055        }
056
057}
